wikipedia_page.main: Tony McWalter (born 20 March 1945 in Worksop) is a politician in the United Kingdom. He was Labour Party and Co-operative Member of Parliament for Hemel Hempstead between 1997 and 2005.

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 2001 United Kingdom general election

List of MPs elected in the 2005 United Kingdom general election
response: | Hemel Hempstead || Mike Penning || Conservative || Tony McWalter || Labour/Co-operative

At the 2005 general election Penning stood in the Labour-held seat of Hemel Hempstead, narrowly defeating sitting MP Tony McWalter. Penning overturned McWalter's 2001 majority of 3,742 votes and won the seat (after a partial recount) by 499 votes. In July 2007, Penning was promoted by Conservative Leader David Cameron to the post of Shadow Minister for Public Health.

response: * Tony McWalter, politician, former MP for Hemel Hempstead

His parliamentary constituency was abolished by boundary changes in 1997. He stood for the seat that replaced it, Hemel Hempstead, in the 1997 general election, but lost to the Labour Co-operative candidate, Tony McWalter.
*Tony McWalter MP for Hemel Hemstead from 1997 till 2005. Worked at the school from 2005 till 2019
